title: Google wants to win the quantum computing race by being the tortoise, not the hare
content:
The most exciting name in quantum computing today is Google. Last year’s time crystals breakthrough was the culmination of decades of academic effort from the Search giant, and it proved Big G is a clear front-runner in the world of cutting-edge quantum physics research. Despite having virtually no B2B presence in the quantum computing marketplace, the Mountain View company managed to leverage itself as one of the most important players in the field. Google’s position comes as a bit of a surprise when you consider the competition. D-Wave’s been making quantum computers for about as long as Google has been…

This story continues at The Next Web

Or just read more coverage about: Google
description: Slow and steady wins the race, and Google's spent the past couple of decades working towards a quantum future. Will it be enough?
